results.content:
I am what you call a course hopper.  Only cause some of the courses provided here arent the type of my teaching style.  But the Vertex Academy is the only one that really got through me.  I struggled on JS a lot and after 7 different courses, I thought JS was not for me and my learning skills is not for programming but this course type of teaching made me really understand the concept.  If you know web developing the course may be a little slow for you but to us new comers with no programming background the instructor does really well of explaining the concept.  First they show you the theory and how things work cause with other course, they just plug in syntax in VS code or sublime text and try to explain but things just happens quickly (for example array pop, vertex explains this well with animations and slides then jump on their sublime text) Then they jump into practice which makes things a lot easier.  I cannot wait to learn more courses from this instructor.  I am so looking forward to their Javascript  course!  
Although this course has small amount of enrollment than the other course, dont let that fool you, this course delivers.  I also thought the higher the enrollment number the better.
Regarding asking questions, I have had questions ignored in other courses but in this course they respond within 24hrs.
keep up the great work guys!

results.content: Only HTML and CSS part is good, They rushed a lot specially in back end.

response.content:
Hi Melika!

Thanks for the feedback. It seems the problem is that you didn’t follow the program correctly.

You enrolled in the course on February 7th and by March 6th you had already finished 85% of it. This course is 50+ hours of full stack web development and 30 days is far too short a time to have gone through 85% of it. Your pace was extremely high, like Formula One racing :)

As a rule, it should take a minimum of 3-4 months to complete the course because: 

1/ The course covers many topics in both front-end and back-end web development. These need time to be totally absorbed by the student, ESPECIALLY back-end development. You cannot rush through it and expect to learn it well. Proper time MUST be taken.

2/ The course has nine major projects, as well as many exercises and mini-projects. Again, to really learn the concepts, the student needs to take the time to get used to them, to test them on their own computer and to ask questions in the Q&A section of the course. If you check the Q&A section, you will see that we respond to every student and we give very detailed answers because we do care about the success of our students. 

If you really want to get most of the course, we highly recommend that you watch it one more time from the very beginning and ask questions wherever you have them. We will be happy to help you succeed on your web development journey :) Feel free to post your questions in the Q&A section of the course! 

Best of luck and happy coding!
response.content_html:
Hi Melika!

Thanks for the feedback. It seems the problem is that you didn’t follow the program correctly.

You enrolled in the course on February 7th and by March 6th you had already finished 85% of it. This course is 50+ hours of full stack web development and 30 days is far too short a time to have gone through 85% of it. Your pace was extremely high, like Formula One racing :)

As a rule, it should take a minimum of 3-4 months to complete the course because:

1/ The course covers many topics in both front-end and back-end web development. These need time to be totally absorbed by the student, ESPECIALLY back-end development. You cannot rush through it and expect to learn it well. Proper time MUST be taken.

2/ The course has nine major projects, as well as many exercises and mini-projects. Again, to really learn the concepts, the student needs to take the time to get used to them, to test them on their own computer and to ask questions in the Q&A section of the course. If you check the Q&A section, you will see that we respond to every student and we give very detailed answers because we do care about the success of our students.

If you really want to get most of the course, we highly recommend that you watch it one more time from the very beginning and ask questions wherever you have them. We will be happy to help you succeed on your web development journey :) Feel free to post your questions in the Q&A section of the course!

Best of luck and happy coding!

results.content:
PROS: clear and concise. Very easy to understand. 
CONS: Jquery is pretty outdated. You should know it but if you want a job, you are better spending your time learning React or Angular. 

The latter part of the course, starting from the REST API section feels a bit rushed. The front end section of this course is very good.

response.content:
Hi Daniel!

We are happy that you find the course very concise and easy to understand :) Many thanks for the feedback!

Regarding the back-end section of the course and jQuery: 

1/ As a rule, back-end development is MUCH more difficult for students and it takes at least twice the time and effort to learn back-end than it does to learn front-end development. The main reason is that in front-end development, we have an immediate visual response from the browser. It’s something that we are used to in our everyday lives – having a visual response which we can see with our own eyes.  
However, in back-end development, we don’t have a lot of visual support because back-end development is all about the “communication” between server and database. Consequently, many things have to be visualized with the help of imagination. That’s why we did our best to build the back-end section of the course with as many animated slides as possible to help in understanding how the interaction between server and database works. 

2/ jQuery was very popular for a long period of time. As a result, there are so many websites which have been built with jQuery. So, there are at least two big reasons why you need to learn jQuery. 
Reason 1 - Web developers need to support these websites. And of course, to be able to do that, they need to know jQuery. 
Reason 2 - Many companies are investing in shifting from jQuery to React/Angular/Vue.js. And of course, to rewrite the code of these websites, you need to understand how jQuery works. 

Happy coding and see you in the course! Feel free to post your questions in the Q&A section of the course. We are always happy to help! :)
response.content_html:
Hi Daniel!

We are happy that you find the course very concise and easy to understand :) Many thanks for the feedback!

Regarding the back-end section of the course and jQuery:

1/ As a rule, back-end development is MUCH more difficult for students and it takes at least twice the time and effort to learn back-end than it does to learn front-end development. The main reason is that in front-end development, we have an immediate visual response from the browser. It’s something that we are used to in our everyday lives – having a visual response which we can see with our own eyes.
However, in back-end development, we don’t have a lot of visual support because back-end development is all about the “communication” between server and database. Consequently, many things have to be visualized with the help of imagination. That’s why we did our best to build the back-end section of the course with as many animated slides as possible to help in understanding how the interaction between server and database works.

2/ jQuery was very popular for a long period of time. As a result, there are so many websites which have been built with jQuery. So, there are at least two big reasons why you need to learn jQuery.
Reason 1 - Web developers need to support these websites. And of course, to be able to do that, they need to know jQuery.
Reason 2 - Many companies are investing in shifting from jQuery to React/Angular/Vue.js. And of course, to rewrite the code of these websites, you need to understand how jQuery works.

Happy coding and see you in the course! Feel free to post your questions in the Q&A section of the course. We are always happy to help! :)

results.content:
This course is definitely the best web development course in Udemy. 
I tried other courses with more reviews and more enrolled students. I'm sure this course is different and much better than other courses, no matter its rhythm or structure...
At the beginning, I feel like the teachers are like professional robots, they don't talk anything else or like jokes or introduce themselves, we don't even know what they look like, but I really like the way of teaching such as the moderate pace, the straightforward animations, clear ppt structure. ..And when I posted my question, I didn't expect they can still answer to me immediately! If you filter the questions, you will find there are no any unanswered questions cuz they are really really really responsible. They can answer each one's questions with clear pictures or samples even this course was posted a few years ago. This is touching for me and this is the first time I feel like the instructor of an online-course is a real teacher in my life, like other my favorite responsible teachers in my school. And I see lots of students from all over the world posted their questions, the teachers still continue answering us patiently, isn't it amazing?
The course content is also really useful and practical. Before taking this course, I have already learned most of basic knowledge, so when I enrolled other courses, I don't feel I improve or learn something new. But when I started the project in this course I realized I still lack many practical skills and techniques. I learned many knowledge that is unavailable in other web development courses. This course can definitely provided you with the necessary practical techniques you needed and improve you a lot!
I really appreciate your hard-working, and your patience to your students!! Thank you!

response.content:
Hello Ciaran,

Most likely, you are already not a novice :) that's why the pace of the course is a little slow for you. 

This should help you. You have the option to play your video lectures at different speeds (.5x, 1x, 1.25x, 1.5x or 2x). Here’s a short instruction on how to do that: https://ufbsupport.udemy.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005369667-Change-Video-Speed

results.content:
Thank you So much for this amazing course. You guys are amazing. I have been trying to learn front end development for the past 3 years, but without success. But thank god I didn't gave up and luckily found your awesome course. You guys totally understand how a student thinks and you guys know how to teach, which is very rare and god gifted quality. Which can change lives of individuals as well as of families. Thank you so much.

This Course is undoubtedly THE BEST COURSE ON FRONT END DEVELOPMENT in the World. Each video starts with awesome animation which explains the concept and then the same concept is reinforced with practical examples. The authors voice is clear and with pauses between the sentences which makes it very easy to understand. Each concept is explained one at a time.

The best part is the projects which are explained very very well. I don't understand how can some people give this course any less than 5 STAR RATING, I doubt there intentions.

results.content: The best Front End Development course I've taken! I've used all the "big names" in online courses, and this is the most comprehensive course I've taken. On other learning platforms, oftentimes you're only coding a portion of the site and I think you miss the "big picture". In this course, you build the projects completely from the ground up. And the instructors are incredibly responsive to all questions. Give these guys your money, they deserve it!
results.content_html: The best Front End Development course I've taken! I've used all the "big names" in online courses, and this is the most comprehensive course I've taken. On other learning platforms, oftentimes you're only coding a portion of the site and I think you miss the "big picture". In this course, you build the projects completely from the ground up. And the instructors are incredibly responsive to all questions. Give these guys your money, they deserve it!

results.content_html: The content is awesome, I would like to see the examples applied in different scenarios.

results.content:
I've only completed the first nine sections but they have been very good. First and foremost, I enjoy the large and comprehensive projects that follows each main section. They are extremely instructive and help ensure that the information that was taught is retained. Not only that, but it helps refreshes enthusiasm as you have something to look forward to besides pure theory and lecture. Aside from the excellent projects, the general course flow for each topic is great as there are visual diagrams illustrating what the teaching is saying. At the end of each video, there is a fairly comprehensive example that demonstrates each subtopic, which I find helpful.

If you have previous programming experience like I do, then I'd recommend watching the videos at 1.5x times speed or more. The teachers are still articulate at high speeds. 

This review will probably be updated once I finish the course.
results.content_html:
I've only completed the first nine sections but they have been very good. First and foremost, I enjoy the large and comprehensive projects that follows each main section. They are extremely instructive and help ensure that the information that was taught is retained. Not only that, but it helps refreshes enthusiasm as you have something to look forward to besides pure theory and lecture. Aside from the excellent projects, the general course flow for each topic is great as there are visual diagrams illustrating what the teaching is saying. At the end of each video, there is a fairly comprehensive example that demonstrates each subtopic, which I find helpful.

If you have previous programming experience like I do, then I'd recommend watching the videos at 1.5x times speed or more. The teachers are still articulate at high speeds.

This review will probably be updated once I finish the course.

results.content: Good tutorial for beginners. The videos are very clear and the exercises are very helpful to really solidify the knowledge from the classes. I need to mention that this is one of the few courses with clear and animated slides. These slides are so clear that sometimes the coding that comes afterwards is redundant. Finally, the instructors are very attentive when answering doubts or questions. I would absolutely recommend this course for anyone with no previous knowledge on web development, there are a few points that can make it better, but it's certainly worth it. Thank you!

I would absolutely recommend this course for anyone with no previous knowledge on web development, there are a few points that can make it better, but it's certainly worth it. Thank you!
